intro: Tristagma inflatum, commonly known as the inflated tristagma, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its unique floral structure consists of five reflexed petals that enclose a prominent, inflated ovary, giving it its common name. Tristagma inflatum is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in local pollination dynamics.
